EasyBike is an open source and cross platform project for public bikes. 
Created by Marc Magnin and Étienne Michon on behalf of the Public Bike Gang.

Any suggestion? 
Please contact us at easybike@outlook.fr. 
Twitter: https://twitter.com/easybike_


You'll find the open source cross platform project on Git. 
If you feel that you want to be part of it, join! 

A special thanks to Florie for her help and patience waiting for me coding hours and hours.
There is nothing such a warmfull review, this is the fuel of the hard work.
This app will never get any ads. Economy must change and advertising is not a solution. If you like this app and think that the hard work is worth it, feel free to offer us a beer.
This app is also available on Windows Phone. Click here to tell your friends!

EasyBike do not collect any personal informations belonging to its users.

It\'s lonely here... \nAdd some favorites by tapping on a station or on a searched location. :)
Tap "download cities" on the menu panel
Then tap on a city to download or remove it. It will download the stations list from the selected service. Then you will have the stations locations even offline.
If there are some new stations provided by the public bike service, you can refresh that list by removing and downloading again the city. This list will get bigger on future updates.
Switch between bike and station mode
Tap on the bike icon or (P) icon on the bottom right corner.
If you are seeking for bikes, after tapping on a station it will provide the walk path to get there.
Otherwise if you are looking to park your bike, it will provide the cycle path.
Tap once on the position button in the command bar, it will focus on your location. Tap again on the button to activate the compass.

Dragging the map when you are in location or compass mode will deactivate the location or compass mode. To reset the north of the map just tap on the top right corner button that appear if the north of the map have changed.
Start typing what you are looking for in the search bar.
Get the address from a location
Hold on the map. It will shows up the found address.
Tap on a station or on a searched location to show up an action bar, then press the star icon. It will store the location of the point.

Like a "Dude, where is my car" app, if you want to easily get back to your home / car / whereever location, just hold a finger on the map and add it to your favorites. It\'s then dead easy to get back somewhere.
While on the view dedicated to favorites, tap on a favorite to show the location on the map. To remove a favorite, just slide it to the right or left.
Press the direction button, it will start Google Map with the locations sets.
You can then get your headphones on, lock your phone, put it in your pocket and listen to the directions from Google Map :)
By tapping on a bike station or on a searched location, you can share that position.
The message will automatically contains the address if it has been resolved. It will also contains direct links to the EasyBike app, IPhone/IPad native map and Google map.
